content.question:
Which of the following series converge?
<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, n times, open parenthesis, 1 over e, close parenthesis, to the n power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mi>n</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator n factorial, and denominator 100 to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator open parenthesis, n factorial, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator, open parenthesis, 2 n, close parenthesis, factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>!</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
